newsitem.title: CHINA: Microsoft to help China bank with system.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to help China bank with system.

text.p: Microsoft Corp has signed an agreement to develop an advanced computer system based on its software for the China Investment Bank, the China Daily said on Tuesday.
The system would be used to link the bank's headquarters in Beijing with its 24 branches across China, the newspaper said.
Bank president Liu Dawei said the system would help the bank improve management, speed up information flow and enhance competitiveness in the Chinese financial market.
The first phase of the network would be completed by June next year, the newspaper said. It did not say how much the system would cost.
The first phase would include a data bank, electronic mail, system management and banking counter-service software, it said.
The bank had registered capital of 4.0 billion yuan ($482 million) when established in 1981.
The newspaper gave no further details.
